Headline: #J14 Jeffery Jump Temporary Reroute near Jeffery/73rd
ShortDescription: J14 Jeffery Jump buses are rerouted in both directions: due to street blockage near Jeffery/73rd.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
#J14 Jeffery Jump buses are temporarily rerouted in both directions: 

Northbound via Jeffery, 73rd, Yates, 71st, Jeffery, and resume normal route.
Southbound via Jeffery, 67th, Stony Island, 73rd, Jeffery and resume normal route due to street blockage near Jeffery/73rd.

Allow extra travel time.

Headline: #63 63rd Temporary Reroute near 63rd/Dorchester
ShortDescription: 63 63rd  buses temp. rerouted : due to, police activity near 63rd/Dorchester.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
63 63rd  buses are temporarily rerouted in both directions near 63rd/Dorchester, due to police activity near 63rd/Dorchester.

Eastbound buses will operate via 63rd, Dorchester, 64th, Blackstone and 63rd including the normal route streets.

Westbound buses will operate via Stony Island, 64th, Dorchester and 63rd.

Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Howard bound Red Line Service Delayed at North/Clybourn
ShortDescription: Howard bound Red Line trains are standing at North/Clybourn due to police activity. Crews working to restore service.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Howard bound Red Line trains are standing at North/Clybourn due to police activity.

At this time, also consider other service alternatives that may serve your trip, such as nearby bus routes, or using buses to other rail lines.

Personnel are working to restore service. Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Howard bound Red Line Service Resuming Normal Routing
ShortDescription: Howard bound Red Line service is resuming its normal routing, via the subway, btwn Fullerton & Cermak-Chinatown after an earlier reroute.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Howard bound Red Line service is resuming its normal routing, via the subway, between Fullerton & Cermak-Chinatown.

Trains were temporarily rerouted via the elevated lines due to police activity.

Allow extra travel time.
